intro: Senecio submontanus, commonly known as the mountain groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense inflorescences. Senecio submontanus is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand harsh, alpine conditions.
